docs.title: Digital Mobility Platform
docs.text: Welcome to the Digital Mobility Platform documentation. A modern, full-featured ride-sharing/taxi application built with Expo and React Native.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Digital Mobility Platform is a comprehensive mobile solution for on-demand transportation. Built with cutting-edge technologies, it delivers a seamless experience for passengers seeking reliable, affordable rides.

  • Platform: Android, iOS, and Web
  • Framework: Expo + React Native
  • Backend: Supabase
  • Maps: Mapbox GL
  • Language: TypeScript

docs.title: Core Functionality
docs.text:
• User Authentication - Secure email/password authentication with Supabase
  • Interactive Maps - Powered by Mapbox for high-performance mapping
  • Real-Time Tracking - Track your ride from booking to completion
  • Multiple Vehicle Types - Economy, Comfort, Premium, and XL options
  • Flexible Payments - Credit/debit cards, mobile wallets, and cash
  • Ride History - Complete record of all your trips with receipts
  • Saved Addresses - Quick access to Home, Work, and favorite locations
  • Safety Features - Trip sharing, emergency contacts, and 24/7 support

docs.title: User Experience
docs.text:
• Animated Onboarding - Smooth first-time user experience with 3-slide carousel
  • Dual Themes - Light and dark mode support
  • Offline Support - Access history and saved data without internet
  • Push Notifications - Stay updated on ride status and promotions
  • Multi-Language - Support for multiple languages

docs.title: Technical Highlights
docs.text:
• Cross-Platform - Single codebase for Android, iOS, and Web
  • TypeScript - Type-safe development with strict mode enabled
  • React Query - Efficient server state management and caching
  • Real-Time Updates - Live ride tracking and driver location updates
  • Optimized Performance - Fast load times and smooth animations
  • Secure - Row-level security and encrypted data storage

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get started with the Mobility platform in minutes:

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js 18 or later
  • Expo CLI
  • Android Studio (for Android) or Xcode (for iOS)
  • Supabase account
  • Mapbox account

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
# Clone the repository
git clone <https://github.com/Bode683/digital-mobility-platform>
cd mobility

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Configure environment variables
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your API keys

# Start development server
npm start

Full Installation Guide →

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
Frontend

  • Expo SDK 54 - React Native framework
  • React Native 0.81 - Mobile app framework
  • TypeScript 5.9 - Type-safe JavaScript
  • Expo Router - File-based routing with typed routes
  • React Query - Server state management
  • Reanimated - High-performance animations

Backend

  • Supabase - Backend-as-a-Service
  • PostgreSQL database
  • Real-time subscriptions
  • Authentication
  • Row-level security
  • Mapbox GL - Maps and location services
  • Interactive maps
  • Geocoding (forward/reverse)
  • Routing and directions

State Management

  • React Context for global state
  • React Query for server state
  • AsyncStorage for persistence

UI Components

  • React Native Paper
  • Custom component library
  • Material Design icons

docs.title: Mobility API Reference
docs.text: Technical reference for the Digital Mobility Platform API and integration documentation.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Mobility Platform uses Supabase as its backend-as-a-service, providing:

  • RESTful API endpoints
  • Real-time subscriptions
  • PostgreSQL database
  • Row-level security
  • Authentication and authorization

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text: https://your-project.supabase.co

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: All API requests require authentication using Supabase JWT tokens.

docs.title: Authentication Flow
docs.text:
import { supabase } from '@/lib/supabase'

// Sign up
const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.signUp({
  email: 'user@example.com',
  password: 'secure-password'
})

// Sign in
const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({
  email: 'user@example.com',
  password: 'password'
})

// Get session
const { data: { session } } = await supabase.auth.getSession()

// Sign out
await supabase.auth.signOut()

docs.title: Headers
docs.text:
Include the auth token in requests:

Authorization: Bearer <your-jwt-token>
apikey: <your-supabase-anon-key>

docs.title: Sign Up
docs.text:
POST /auth/v1/signup
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "password123"
}

Response: 

{
  "user": {
    "id": "uuid",
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "created_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z"
  },
  "session": {
    "access_token": "jwt-token",
    "refresh_token": "refresh-token"
  }
}

docs.title: Sign In
docs.text:
POST /auth/v1/token?grant_type=password
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "password123"
}

docs.title: Get User Profile
docs.text:
const { data, error } = await supabase
  .from('profiles')
  .select('*')
  .eq('id', userId)
  .single()

SQL Schema: 

CREATE TABLE profiles (
  id UUID REFERENCES auth.users PRIMARY KEY,
  email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  full_name TEXT,
  phone_number TEXT,
  avatar_url TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

docs.title: Subscribe to Trip Updates
docs.text:
const subscription = supabase
  .channel('trip-updates')
  .on(
    'postgres_changes',
    {
      event: 'UPDATE',
      schema: 'public',
      table: 'trips',
      filter: `id=eq.${tripId}`
    },
    (payload) => {
      console.log('Trip updated:', payload.new)
      // Update UI with new trip status
    }
  )
  .subscribe()

// Unsubscribe when done
subscription.unsubscribe()

    const { latitude, longitude } = payload
    // Update driver marker on map
  })
  .subscribe()

docs.title: Forward Geocoding (Address to Coordinates)
docs.text:
const forwardGeocode = async (address: string) => {
  const url = `https://api.mapbox.com/geocoding/v5/mapbox.places/${encodeURIComponent(address)}.json`
  const params = new URLSearchParams({
    access_token: MAPBOX_TOKEN,
    limit: '5',
    types: 'address,poi'
  })

  const response = await fetch(`${url}?${params}`)
  const data = await response.json()

  return data.features.map(feature => ({
    address: feature.place_name,
    coordinates: feature.geometry.coordinates
  }))
}

docs.title: Reverse Geocoding (Coordinates to Address)
docs.text:
const reverseGeocode = async (latitude: number, longitude: number) => {
  const url = `https://api.mapbox.com/geocoding/v5/mapbox.places/${longitude},${latitude}.json`
  const params = new URLSearchParams({
    access_token: MAPBOX_TOKEN,
    types: 'address'
  })

  const response = await fetch(`${url}?${params}`)
  const data = await response.json()

  return data.features[0]?.place_name || 'Unknown location'
}

docs.title: Get Route Between Points
docs.text:
const getRoute = async (
  startCoords: [number, number],
  endCoords: [number, number]
) => {
  const coordinates = `${startCoords[0]},${startCoords[1]};${endCoords[0]},${endCoords[1]}`
  const url = `https://api.mapbox.com/directions/v5/mapbox/driving/${coordinates}`

  const params = new URLSearchParams({
    access_token: MAPBOX_TOKEN,
    geometries: 'geojson',
    overview: 'full',
    steps: 'true'
  })

  const response = await fetch(`${url}?${params}`)
  const data = await response.json()

  return {
    route: data.routes[0].geometry,
    distance: data.routes[0].distance,  // meters
    duration: data.routes[0].duration,  // seconds
    steps: data.routes[0].legs[0].steps
  }
}

docs.title: useProfile
docs.text:
import { useQuery } from '@tanstack/react-query'

export const useProfile = (userId: string) => {
  return useQuery({
    queryKey: ['profile', userId],
    queryFn: async () => {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from('profiles')
        .select('*')
        .eq('id', userId)
        .single()

      if (error) throw error
      return data
    }
  })
}

// Usage
const { data: profile, isLoading, error } = useProfile(userId)

docs.title: useCreateTrip (Mutation)
docs.text:
import { useMutation, useQueryClient } from '@tanstack/react-query'

export const useCreateTrip = () => {
  const queryClient = useQueryClient()

  return useMutation({
    mutationFn: async (tripData: TripCreateInput) => {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from('trips')
        .insert(tripData)
        .select()
        .single()

      if (error) throw error
      return data
    },
    onSuccess: () => {
      // Invalidate and refetch trips
      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: ['trips'] })
    }
  })
}

// Usage
const createTrip = useCreateTrip()

const handleBookRide = async () => {
  try {
    const trip = await createTrip.mutateAsync({
      user_id: userId,
      pickup_address: '...',
      // ... other trip data
    })
    console.log('Trip created:', trip)
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Failed to create trip:', error)
  }
}

docs.title: TypeScript Interfaces
docs.text:
// User Profile
interface Profile {
  id: string
  email: string
  full_name: string | null
  phone_number: string | null
  avatar_url: string | null
  created_at: string
  updated_at: string
}

// Saved Address
interface SavedAddress {
  id: string
  user_id: string
  label: string  // 'home' | 'work' | custom
  address: string
  latitude: number
  longitude: number
  created_at: string
}

// Trip
interface Trip {
  id: string
  user_id: string
  driver_id: string | null
  pickup_address: string
  pickup_lat: number
  pickup_lng: number
  dropoff_address: string
  dropoff_lat: number
  dropoff_lng: number
  distance: number  // kilometers
  duration: number  // minutes
  fare: number
  status: TripStatus
  vehicle_type: VehicleType
  created_at: string
  completed_at: string | null
}

// Trip Status
type TripStatus =
  | 'pending'
  | 'driver_assigned'
  | 'driver_arriving'
  | 'driver_arrived'
  | 'in_progress'
  | 'completed'
  | 'cancelled'

// Vehicle Type
type VehicleType =
  | 'economy'
  | 'comfort'
  | 'premium'
  | 'xl'

// Payment Method
interface PaymentMethod {
  id: string
  user_id: string
  type: 'card' | 'wallet' | 'cash'
  last_four: string | null
  card_brand: string | null
  is_default: boolean
  created_at: string
}

docs.title: API Errors
docs.text:
interface APIError {
  message: string
  code?: string
  details?: any
}

// Example error handling
try {
  const { data, error } = await supabase
    .from('trips')
    .select('*')

  if (error) throw error

  return data
} catch (error: any) {
  if (error.code === 'PGRST116') {
    // No rows returned
    console.log('No trips found')
  } else if (error.message) {
    console.error('Error:', error.message)
  } else {
    console.error('Unknown error occurred')
  }
}

docs.title: Network Error Handling
docs.text:
import axios from 'axios'
import axiosRetry from 'axios-retry'

// Configure automatic retries
axiosRetry(axios, {
  retries: 3,
  retryDelay: axiosRetry.exponentialDelay,
  retryCondition: (error) => {
    return axiosRetry.isNetworkOrIdempotentRequestError(error) ||
           error.response?.status === 429  // Rate limit
  }
})

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text:
Supabase has default rate limits:

  • Anonymous requests: 30 requests per minute
  • Authenticated requests: 60 requests per minute
  • Realtime connections: 100 concurrent connections

Handle rate limits:

const handleRateLimit = async (fn: () => Promise<any>) => {
  try {
    return await fn()
  } catch (error: any) {
    if (error.status === 429) {
      // Wait and retry
      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000))
      return await fn()
    }
    throw error
  }
}

docs.title: 1. Use React Query for Caching
docs.text:
// ✅ Good - Cached and automatically refetched
const { data } = useQuery({
  queryKey: ['profile'],
  queryFn: fetchProfile,
  staleTime: 5 * 60 * 1000  // 5 minutes
})

// ❌ Bad - Fetches on every render
const [profile, setProfile] = useState(null)
useEffect(() => {
  fetchProfile().then(setProfile)
}, [])

docs.title: 2. Implement Optimistic Updates
docs.text:
const updateProfile = useMutation({
  mutationFn: (updates) => supabase.from('profiles').update(updates),
  onMutate: async (updates) => {
    // Cancel outgoing queries
    await queryClient.cancelQueries({ queryKey: ['profile'] })

    // Snapshot previous value
    const previous = queryClient.getQueryData(['profile'])

    // Optimistically update
    queryClient.setQueryData(['profile'], (old) => ({
      ...old,
      ...updates
    }))

    return { previous }
  },
  onError: (err, variables, context) => {
    // Rollback on error
    queryClient.setQueryData(['profile'], context.previous)
  }
})

docs.title: 3. Handle Offline State
docs.text:
import NetInfo from '@react-native-community/netinfo'

const { data, isLoading } = useQuery({
  queryKey: ['trips'],
  queryFn: fetchTrips,
  enabled: isOnline,  // Only fetch when online
  networkMode: 'offlineFirst'  // Serve cached data when offline
})

docs.title: 4. Secure API Keys
docs.text:
// ✅ Good - Use environment variables
const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL

// ❌ Bad - Hardcoded keys
const SUPABASE_URL = 'https://abc123.supabase.co'

docs.title: Mobility Configuration
docs.text: Complete guide to configuring the Digital Mobility Platform for development and production environments.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Mobility platform uses a combination of environment variables, configuration files, and runtime settings to control behavior across different environments and platforms.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: All environment-specific configuration is managed through the .env file.

docs.title: Required Variables
docs.text:
# Supabase Backend Configuration
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project.supabase.co
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=your-anon-public-key

# Mapbox Maps Configuration
EXPO_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_TOKEN=pk.your_mapbox_public_token
RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN=sk.your_mapbox_secret_token

docs.title: Optional Variables
docs.text:
# API Configuration
API_TIMEOUT=30000  # API request timeout in milliseconds
API_RETRY_COUNT=3  # Number of retry attempts for failed requests

# Feature Flags
ENABLE_ANALYTICS=true
ENABLE_CRASH_REPORTING=true
ENABLE_DEBUG_MODE=false

# Map Configuration
DEFAULT_MAP_ZOOM=15
DEFAULT_MAP_PITCH=0
DEFAULT_MAP_BEARING=0

docs.title: Development Environment
docs.text:
# .env.development
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://dev-project.supabase.co
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=dev-key
EXPO_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_TOKEN=pk.dev_token
RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN=sk.dev_token
ENABLE_DEBUG_MODE=true
ENABLE_ANALYTICS=false

docs.title: Production Environment
docs.text:
# .env.production
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://prod-project.supabase.co
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=prod-key
EXPO_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_TOKEN=pk.prod_token
RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN=sk.prod_token
ENABLE_DEBUG_MODE=false
ENABLE_ANALYTICS=true
ENABLE_CRASH_REPORTING=true

docs.title: Database Schema
docs.text:
The app expects the following Supabase tables:

profiles 

CREATE TABLE profiles (
  id UUID REFERENCES auth.users PRIMARY KEY,
  email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  full_name TEXT,
  phone_number TEXT,
  avatar_url TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

saved_addresses 

CREATE TABLE saved_addresses (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  user_id UUID REFERENCES profiles(id),
  label TEXT NOT NULL,  -- 'home', 'work', or custom
  address TEXT NOT NULL,
  latitude DECIMAL(10, 8),
  longitude DECIMAL(11, 8),
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

trips 

CREATE TABLE trips (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  user_id UUID REFERENCES profiles(id),
  driver_id UUID,
  pickup_address TEXT,
  pickup_lat DECIMAL(10, 8),
  pickup_lng DECIMAL(11, 8),
  dropoff_address TEXT,
  dropoff_lat DECIMAL(10, 8),
  dropoff_lng DECIMAL(11, 8),
  distance DECIMAL(10, 2),  -- in kilometers
  duration INTEGER,  -- in minutes
  fare DECIMAL(10, 2),
  status TEXT,  -- 'pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled'
  vehicle_type TEXT,  -- 'economy', 'comfort', 'premium', 'xl'
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  completed_at TIMESTAMP
);

payment_methods 

CREATE TABLE payment_methods (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  user_id UUID REFERENCES profiles(id),
  type TEXT NOT NULL,  -- 'card', 'wallet', 'cash'
  last_four TEXT,
  card_brand TEXT,
  is_default BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

docs.title: Row Level Security (RLS)
docs.text:
Enable RLS and create policies:

-- Enable RLS
ALTER TABLE profiles ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE saved_addresses ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE trips ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE payment_methods ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Profiles policies
CREATE POLICY "Users can view own profile" ON profiles
  FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = id);

CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile" ON profiles
  FOR UPDATE USING (auth.uid() = id);

-- Saved addresses policies
CREATE POLICY "Users can view own addresses" ON saved_addresses
  FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

CREATE POLICY "Users can insert own addresses" ON saved_addresses
  FOR INSERT WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);

-- Trips policies
CREATE POLICY "Users can view own trips" ON trips
  FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

-- Payment methods policies
CREATE POLICY "Users can view own payment methods" ON payment_methods
  FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

docs.title: Supabase Storage
docs.text:
Configure storage buckets for user uploads:

-- Create avatars bucket
INSERT INTO storage.buckets (id, name, public)
VALUES ('avatars', 'avatars', true);

-- Create storage policy
CREATE POLICY "Avatar images are publicly accessible"
  ON storage.objects FOR SELECT
  USING (bucket_id = 'avatars');

CREATE POLICY "Users can upload own avatar"
  ON storage.objects FOR INSERT
  WITH CHECK (bucket_id = 'avatars' AND auth.uid()::text = (storage.foldername(name))[1]);

docs.title: Access Tokens
docs.text:
You need two types of Mapbox tokens:

  1. Public Token (EXPO_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_TOKEN)
  2. Used for map display and client-side API calls
  3. Can be safely included in client code

  4. Created in Mapbox dashboard → Access Tokens

  5. Secret Download Token (RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN)

  6. Used for downloading Mapbox SDK during build
  7. Should never be committed to version control
  8. Created in Mapbox dashboard → Access Tokens

Configure API settings in src/lib/httpClient.ts:

docs.title: React Query Configuration
docs.text:
Configure caching and data fetching in src/lib/queryClient.ts:

export const queryClientConfig = {
  defaultOptions: {
    queries: {
      staleTime: 5 * 60 * 1000,  // 5 minutes
      cacheTime: 10 * 60 * 1000,  // 10 minutes
      retry: 2,
      refetchOnWindowFocus: false,
      refetchOnReconnect: true
    },
    mutations: {
      retry: 1
    }

}

docs.title: TypeScript Configuration
docs.text:
tsconfig.json includes path aliases for cleaner imports:

{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "strict": true,
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["./src/*"],
      "@/components/*": ["./src/components/*"],
      "@/hooks/*": ["./src/hooks/*"],
      "@/lib/*": ["./src/lib/*"],
      "@/api/*": ["./src/api/*"],
      "@/features/*": ["./src/features/*"]

}

docs.title: Babel Configuration
docs.text:
babel.config.js with module resolver:

module.exports = function(api) {
  api.cache(true);
  return {
    presets: ['babel-preset-expo'],
    plugins: [
      'react-native-reanimated/plugin',
      [
        'module-resolver',
        {
          root: ['./'],
          alias: {
            '@': './src',
            '@/components': './src/components',
            '@/hooks': './src/hooks',
            '@/lib': './src/lib',
            '@/api': './src/api',
            '@/features': './src/features'
          }
        }
      ]
    ]
  };
};

docs.title: API Key Management
docs.text:
Never commit sensitive keys to version control:

  1. Add .env to .gitignore
  2. Use .env.example as template
  3. Use EAS Secrets for production builds:
eas secret:create --scope project --name SUPABASE_URL --value "https://..."
eas secret:create --scope project --name SUPABASE_KEY --value "..."
eas secret:create --scope project --name MAPBOX_TOKEN --value "pk..."

docs.title: SSL/TLS Configuration
docs.text:
All API communication uses HTTPS:

// Enforce HTTPS
const enforceHttps = (url: string) => {
  if (!url.startsWith('https://') && !__DEV__) {
    throw new Error('Production must use HTTPS');
  }
  return url;
};

}

docs.text:
Configure lazy loading for better performance:

const HomeScreen = lazy(() => import('./screens/Home'));
const ProfileScreen = lazy(() => import('./screens/Profile'));

Configure Sentry or similar:

import * as Sentry from '@sentry/react-native';

Sentry.init({

});

export const logEvent = (event: string, params?: object) => {

docs.title: Mobility Platform Features
docs.text: Comprehensive overview of all features available in the Digital Mobility Platform.

docs.title: 1. User Authentication & Authorization
docs.text:
Secure user authentication powered by Supabase.

Capabilities:

  • Email/Password Authentication - Traditional sign-up and sign-in
  • Session Management - Persistent sessions with automatic token refresh
  • Protected Routes - Automatic redirection based on auth state
  • Profile Management - User profile creation and updates
  • Password Recovery - Secure password reset functionality

Security Features:

  • Encrypted password storage
  • JWT token-based authentication
  • Automatic session expiry
  • Secure API communication

docs.title: 2. Onboarding Experience
docs.text:
Intuitive first-time user experience.

Features:

  • Animated Splash Screen - Smooth logo animation on app launch
  • 3-Slide Carousel - Interactive introduction to key features:
  • Welcome screen with app introduction
  • Feature highlights and benefits
  • Getting started guide
  • Skip Option - Users can skip onboarding if desired
  • One-Time Display - Onboarding shown only on first launch

docs.title: 3. Interactive Maps & Location
docs.text:
Powered by Mapbox GL for high-performance mapping.

Map Features:

  • Real-Time Location Tracking - Track user's current location
  • Interactive Map Controls - Pan, zoom, rotate, and tilt
  • Location Search - Search for addresses and places
  • Place Autocomplete - Smart suggestions while typing
  • Reverse Geocoding - Convert coordinates to addresses
  • Forward Geocoding - Convert addresses to coordinates
  • Custom Map Markers - Visual indicators for locations
  • Map Clustering - Group nearby markers for better performance

Location Features:

  • GPS-based location services
  • Location permission handling
  • Background location updates (when needed)
  • Location accuracy indicators
  • Saved addresses (Home, Work, Favorites)

docs.title: 4. Ride Booking System
docs.text:
Complete ride booking and management functionality.

Booking Features:

  • Pickup & Dropoff Selection - Choose locations on map or search
  • Route Visualization - See route before booking
  • Distance Calculation - Accurate distance estimation
  • Price Estimation - Real-time fare calculation
  • Ride Options - Multiple vehicle types (Economy, Comfort, Premium)
  • Instant Booking - Quick ride confirmation
  • Scheduled Rides - Book rides for future times

Vehicle Types:

Type Description Capacity Features Economy Budget-friendly option 4 passengers Standard vehicle Comfort Mid-tier comfort 4 passengers AC, newer vehicles Premium Luxury experience 4 passengers High-end vehicles, premium service XL Extra space 6 passengers Larger vehicles for groups

Price Calculation:

  • Base fare + distance-based pricing
  • Time-based pricing for longer trips
  • Surge pricing during peak hours
  • Promotional discounts
  • Transparent pricing breakdown

docs.title: 5. Real-Time Ride Tracking
docs.text:
Track your ride from booking to completion.

Tracking Features:

  • Driver Location - Real-time driver position updates
  • ETA Updates - Estimated time of arrival
  • Route Progress - Visual route following
  • Driver Details - Name, photo, vehicle info, rating
  • Contact Driver - In-app calling or messaging
  • Share Ride - Share trip details with contacts

Ride States:

  1. Searching - Finding available drivers
  2. Driver Assigned - Driver accepted request
  3. Driver Arriving - Driver en route to pickup
  4. Arrived - Driver at pickup location
  5. In Progress - Ride in progress
  6. Completed - Ride finished

docs.title: 6. Payment System
docs.text:
Flexible payment options and management.

Payment Methods:

  • Credit/Debit Cards - Visa, Mastercard, Amex
  • Mobile Wallets - Apple Pay, Google Pay
  • Cash Payment - Pay driver directly
  • In-App Wallet - Store credits and balance
  • Corporate Accounts - Business payment options

Payment Features:

  • Secure payment processing
  • Save multiple payment methods
  • Auto-payment for rides
  • Payment history and receipts
  • Refund processing
  • Split payment (coming soon)

docs.title: 7. Ride History
docs.text:
Complete record of all your trips.

History Features:

  • Trip Details - View full ride information
  • Route Map - See the route taken
  • Fare Breakdown - Detailed cost information
  • Driver Information - Driver who completed the trip
  • Timestamps - Pickup and dropoff times
  • Receipts - Download or email receipts
  • Filter & Search - Find specific trips
  • Export Data - Download trip history

docs.title: 8. Profile Management
docs.text:
Manage your account and preferences.

Profile Features:

  • Personal Information - Name, email, phone number
  • Profile Photo - Upload and update profile picture
  • Saved Addresses - Manage frequently used locations
  • Emergency Contacts - Add safety contacts
  • Preferences - Set app preferences
  • Language Settings - Multi-language support
  • Notifications - Configure notification preferences

docs.title: 9. Safety Features
docs.text:
Comprehensive safety measures for peace of mind.

Safety Tools:

  • Share Trip - Share real-time location with trusted contacts
  • Emergency Button - Quick access to emergency services
  • Driver Verification - All drivers verified and background-checked
  • Driver Ratings - See driver ratings before accepting
  • Trip Recording - Ride details logged for safety
  • 24/7 Support - Round-the-clock customer support
  • Insurance Coverage - All rides are insured

docs.title: 10. Rating & Feedback System
docs.text:
Rate drivers and provide feedback.

Rating Features:

  • 5-Star Rating - Rate your driver after each ride
  • Feedback Categories - Predefined feedback options
  • Comments - Add detailed feedback
  • Driver Ratings - See average driver rating
  • Your Rating - View your passenger rating
  • Report Issues - Flag problems during rides

docs.title: 11. Offline Support
docs.text:
Limited functionality when offline.

Offline Capabilities:

  • View saved addresses
  • Access ride history (cached)
  • View profile information
  • Read notifications

Online Required:

  • Booking new rides
  • Real-time tracking
  • Payment processing
  • Location search

docs.title: 12. Push Notifications
docs.text:
Stay informed with timely notifications.

Notification Types:

  • Ride Updates - Driver assigned, arrival, completion
  • Promotions - Special offers and discounts
  • Payment - Payment confirmations and issues
  • Safety - Important safety alerts
  • General - App updates and announcements

docs.title: 13. Multi-Language Support
docs.text:
Use the app in your preferred language.

Supported Languages:

  • English
  • French
  • Spanish (coming soon)
  • German (coming soon)

docs.title: 14. Accessibility Features
docs.text:
Designed for all users.

Accessibility:

  • Screen reader support
  • High contrast mode
  • Large text options
  • Voice commands (coming soon)
  • Wheelchair-accessible vehicles option

docs.title: 15. Theme Support
docs.text:
Customize your visual experience.

Theme Options:

  • Light Mode - Clean, bright interface
  • Dark Mode - Reduced eye strain
  • Automatic - Follow system preferences

docs.title: 16. Performance Optimization
docs.text:
Built for speed and efficiency.

Optimizations:

  • React Query Caching - Smart data caching
  • Image Optimization - Compressed and lazy-loaded images
  • Code Splitting - Faster initial load times
  • Offline Caching - Cache critical data locally
  • Debounced Search - Reduced API calls

docs.title: 17. Cross-Platform Support
docs.text:
Consistent experience across platforms.

Platforms:

  • Android - Android 8.0 (API 26) and above
  • iOS - iOS 14.0 and above
  • Web - Modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

Platform-Specific Features:

  • Native navigation
  • Platform-specific UI elements
  • Optimized performance per platform
  • Native gestures and animations

docs.title: 18. State Management
docs.text:
Efficient data handling.

Technologies:

  • React Query - Server state management
  • React Context - Global app state
  • AsyncStorage - Local data persistence
  • Zustand - Lightweight state management

docs.title: 19. Error Handling
docs.text:
Robust error management.

Error Features:

  • Network Error Recovery - Automatic retry mechanisms
  • User-Friendly Messages - Clear error descriptions
  • Error Logging - Track issues for debugging
  • Fallback UI - Graceful degradation
  • Toast Notifications - Non-intrusive error alerts

docs.title: 20. Analytics & Monitoring
docs.text:
Track usage and performance.

Analytics:

  • User Behavior - Track feature usage
  • Performance Metrics - Monitor app performance
  • Error Tracking - Capture and log errors
  • Crash Reporting - Automatic crash reports
  • Custom Events - Track specific user actions

docs.title: Upcoming Features
docs.text: Features planned for future releases:

  • Ride Pooling - Share rides with other passengers
  • Scheduled Recurring Rides - Set up daily/weekly trips
  • Loyalty Program - Earn points and rewards
  • In-App Chat - Text messaging with driver
  • Multi-Stop Rides - Add multiple destinations

  • Corporate Dashboard - Business management portal

  • Integration APIs - Third-party service integration

docs.title: Mobility Installation Guide
docs.text: Complete guide to installing and setting up the Digital Mobility Platform on your development environment.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Digital Mobility Platform is a modern taxi/ride-sharing application built with Expo and React Native. It runs on Android, iOS, and Web platforms, featuring real-time location tracking, ride booking, and payment processing.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed on your system:

docs.title: Required Software
docs.text:
• Node.js (v18 or later) - Download
  • npm or yarn - Comes with Node.js
  • Git - Download
  • Expo CLI - Will be installed with dependencies

docs.title: For Android Development
docs.text:
• Android Studio - Download
  • Android SDK (API level 26 or higher)
  • Java Development Kit (JDK) - Version 17 recommended

docs.title: For iOS Development (macOS only)
docs.text:
• Xcode (latest version) - Download from App Store
  • CocoaPods - Install via: sudo gem install cocoapods
  • iOS Simulator - Included with Xcode

docs.title: For Web Development
docs.text: • Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)

docs.title: Step 1: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
Clone the Mobility platform repository to your local machine:

git clone <https://github.com/Bode683/digital-mobility-platform>
cd mobility

docs.title: Step 2: Install Dependencies
docs.text:
Install all required npm packages:

npm install

This will install all dependencies including:

  • Expo SDK (~54.0)
  • React Native (0.81.5)
  • Mapbox Maps integration
  • Supabase client
  • React Query for state management
  • And many more...

docs.title: Step 3: Configure Environment Variables
docs.text: The application requires several API keys and configuration values to function properly.

docs.title: Create Environment File
docs.text:
Copy the example environment file:

cp .env.example .env

docs.title: Configure Required Variables
docs.text:
Edit the .env file and add your credentials:

# Supabase Configuration
# Get these from: https://supabase.com/dashboard/project/_/settings/api
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project.supabase.co
EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=your-publishable-key

# Mapbox Configuration
# Get from: https://account.mapbox.com/access-tokens/
EXPO_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_TOKEN=your-mapbox-public-token
RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN=your-mapbox-download-token

docs.title: Supabase Setup
docs.text:
1. Go to Supabase Dashboard
  2. Create a new project or select existing one
  3. Navigate to Settings → API
  4. Copy the Project URL (EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL)
  5. Copy the anon/public key (EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY)

docs.title: Mapbox Setup
docs.text:
1. Go to Mapbox Account
  2. Sign up or log in
  3. Navigate to Access Tokens
  4. Create a new token or use the default public token
  5. Copy the token for both EXPO_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_TOKEN and RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN

docs.title: Configure Android Studio
docs.text:
1. Open Android Studio
  2. Go to SDK Manager (Tools → SDK Manager)
  3. Install Android SDK Platform 26 or higher
  4. Install Android SDK Build-Tools
  5. Install Android Emulator (if not already installed)

docs.title: Set Environment Variables
docs.text:
Add to your ~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc, or equivalent:

export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/Library/Android/sdk  # macOS
# OR
export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/Android/Sdk  # Linux
# OR
export ANDROID_HOME=%LOCALAPPDATA%\Android\Sdk  # Windows

export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME/emulator
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME/tools
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME/tools/bin
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools

docs.title: Install CocoaPods Dependencies
docs.text:
cd ios
pod install
cd ..

docs.title: Configure Xcode
docs.text:
1. Open Xcode
  2. Go to Preferences → Locations
  3. Ensure Command Line Tools is set to your Xcode version

docs.title: Step 5: Start Development Server
docs.text:
Start the Expo development server:

npm start

Or using Expo CLI directly:

npx expo start

You'll see a QR code and several options in the terminal.

docs.title: Using Emulator
docs.text:
1. Start Android emulator from Android Studio
  2. In the Expo terminal, press a to open on Android

Or run directly:

npm run android

docs.title: Using Physical Device
docs.text:
1. Enable Developer Mode on your Android device
  2. Enable USB Debugging
  3. Connect device via USB
  4. Run npm run android

docs.title: Using Simulator
docs.text:
In the Expo terminal, press i to open on iOS simulator.

Or run directly:

npm run ios

docs.title: Using Physical Device
docs.text:
1. Register your device in your Apple Developer account
  2. Configure code signing in Xcode
  3. Build and run through Xcode

docs.title: Run on Web
docs.text:
Start the web development server:

npm run web

The app will open in your default browser at http://localhost:8081.

docs.title: Step 7: Build for Production (Optional)
docs.text: For production builds, the project uses Expo Application Services (EAS Build).

docs.title: Install EAS CLI
docs.text: npm install -g eas-cli

docs.title: Login to EAS
docs.text: eas login

docs.title: Configure EAS Build
docs.text: The project includes an eas.json configuration file. Review and modify if needed.

docs.title: Build for Android
docs.text: eas build --platform android

docs.title: Build for iOS
docs.text: eas build --platform ios

docs.title: Verification
docs.text: After installation, verify everything works:

docs.title: Check App Launch
docs.text:
1. App should display animated splash screen
  2. Onboarding carousel should appear for first-time users
  3. Authentication screen should load properly

docs.title: Test Map Functionality
docs.text:
1. Grant location permissions when prompted
  2. Map should load with Mapbox tiles
  3. Current location marker should appear

docs.title: Test Authentication
docs.text:
1. Try creating a new account
  2. Verify email/password validation
  3. Test sign-in functionality

docs.title: "Metro bundler failed to start"
docs.text:
# Clear Metro cache
npx expo start --clear

docs.title: "Unable to resolve module"
docs.text:
# Clean install
rm -rf node_modules
npm install

docs.title: "Mapbox not loading"
docs.text:
• Verify your Mapbox tokens in .env
  • Ensure RNMAPBOX_MAPS_DOWNLOAD_TOKEN is set
  • For native builds, you need EAS Development Build

docs.title: Android Build Fails
docs.text:
# Clean Android build
cd android
./gradlew clean
cd ..
npm run android

docs.title: iOS Pod Install Fails
docs.text:
# Update CocoaPods
cd ios
pod deintegrate
pod install
cd ..

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Check Configuration for advanced settings
  • See User Guide for usage instructions
  • Visit Support for additional help

docs.title: Clear AsyncStorage
docs.text:
To clear all app data during development:

npm run clear-async-storage

docs.title: Linting
docs.text:
Check code quality:

npm run lint

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you have the Mobility platform installed:

  1. Configure advanced settings
  2. Read the User Guide to understand features
  3. Explore the API Documentation for integration

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text:
• Expo Documentation
  • React Native Documentation
  • Mapbox GL Documentation
  • Supabase Documentation

docs.title: Mobility User Guide
docs.text: Complete guide to using the Digital Mobility Platform for booking rides, managing your account, and more.

docs.title: First Time Setup
docs.text:
When you first open the Mobility app:

  1. Splash Screen - You'll see an animated splash screen with the Mobility logo
  2. Onboarding - A 3-slide carousel introduces you to the app's key features
  3. Welcome and app introduction
  4. Feature highlights
  5. How to get started
  6. Skip Option - You can skip the onboarding by tapping "Skip" if you prefer

docs.title: Sign Up
docs.text:
1. On the authentication screen, tap the Sign Up tab
  2. Enter your email address
  3. Create a secure password (minimum 8 characters)
  4. Tap Create Account
  5. Check your email for verification (if required)

docs.title: Sign In
docs.text:
1. On the authentication screen, tap the Sign In tab
  2. Enter your registered email
  3. Enter your password
  4. Tap Sign In

docs.title: Social Login (Coming Soon)
docs.text: Quick sign-in options with Google, Apple, or Facebook will be available soon.

docs.title: Home Screen
docs.text: The home screen is your command center for booking rides.

docs.title: Main Components
docs.text:
• Interactive Map - Shows your current location and nearby area
  • Location Search - Search for pickup and destination addresses
  • Your Location - Displays your current address
  • Menu Drawer - Access all app features via the hamburger menu (☰)

docs.title: Granting Permissions
docs.text:
For the app to work properly, you'll need to grant:

  • Location Permission - Required for showing your location and booking rides
  • Tap "Allow" when prompted
  • Choose "While Using the App" or "Always" (for background tracking)

docs.title: Step 1: Set Pickup Location
docs.text:
Your current location is automatically set as the pickup point, but you can change it:

Option A: Search 1. Tap the "Where from?" search field 2. Type the pickup address 3. Select from the autocomplete suggestions 4. The map will center on the selected location

Option B: Map Selection 1. Long-press on any location on the map 2. The pickup marker will move to that location 3. The address will be reverse-geocoded and displayed

Option C: Saved Addresses 1. Tap the "Where from?" field 2. Select from "Home" or "Work" if you've saved these addresses 3. Or choose from your favorite locations

docs.title: Step 2: Set Destination
docs.text:
1. Tap the "Where to?" search field
  2. Search for your destination using any of the methods above
  3. A route will be drawn on the map showing your path

docs.title: Step 3: Choose Ride Type
docs.text:
Select the type of vehicle you prefer:

Type Description Best For Economy Budget-friendly rides Solo travelers, short trips Comfort Mid-tier comfort Comfortable rides, medium trips Premium Luxury vehicles Special occasions, business XL Larger vehicles Groups, extra luggage

Each option shows: - Estimated fare - Estimated arrival time (ETA) - Vehicle capacity

docs.title: Step 4: Review and Confirm
docs.text:
1. Review the ride details:
  2. Pickup location
  3. Destination
  4. Estimated distance
  5. Estimated duration
  6. Fare estimate
  7. Choose your payment method
  8. Tap Request Ride or Book Now

docs.title: Scheduled Rides
docs.text:
To book a ride for later:

  1. Tap the clock icon or "Schedule" option
  2. Select date and time
  3. Complete the booking as normal
  4. You'll receive a notification before your scheduled ride

docs.title: Finding Your Driver
docs.text:
After requesting a ride:

  1. Driver Assigned - You'll see driver details:
  2. Driver name and photo
  3. Vehicle make, model, and color
  4. License plate number
  5. Driver rating

  6. Estimated arrival time

  7. Track Driver - Watch your driver's location in real-time on the map

  8. Contact Driver

  9. Tap the phone icon to call
  10. Tap the message icon to send a text (if supported)

docs.title: Driver Arrival
docs.text:
When your driver arrives:

  1. You'll receive a notification
  2. The driver status will show "Arrived"
  3. Look for the vehicle matching the details shown
  4. Verify the license plate before entering

docs.title: Ride in Progress
docs.text:
During your ride:

  • Live Tracking - Follow your route on the map
  • ETA Updates - See estimated time to destination
  • Share Trip - Tap "Share Ride" to send details to friends/family
  • Emergency - Access emergency button if needed (see Safety Features)

docs.title: Ride Completion
docs.text:
When you arrive:

  1. The ride automatically ends
  2. Your payment is processed
  3. You'll see the final fare breakdown
  4. Rate your driver (1-5 stars)
  5. Optionally leave feedback

docs.title: Adding Addresses
docs.text:
1. Open the side menu (☰)
  2. Tap Addresses or Saved Places
  3. Tap Add New Address
  4. Choose address type:
  5. Home
  6. Work
  7. Custom (give it a name)
  8. Enter or select the address
  9. Tap Save

docs.title: Editing Addresses
docs.text:
1. Go to Addresses
  2. Tap on the address you want to edit
  3. Make your changes
  4. Tap Update

docs.title: Deleting Addresses
docs.text:
1. Go to Addresses
  2. Swipe left on the address (iOS) or long-press (Android)
  3. Tap Delete
  4. Confirm deletion

docs.title: Adding a Payment Method
docs.text:
1. Open the side menu
  2. Tap Payment Methods
  3. Tap Add Payment Method
  4. Choose payment type:
  5. Credit/Debit Card
  6. Mobile Wallet (Apple Pay, Google Pay)
  7. Cash
  8. Enter payment details
  9. Tap Save

docs.title: Setting Default Payment
docs.text:
1. Go to Payment Methods
  2. Tap on your preferred method
  3. Toggle Set as Default
  4. This method will be automatically selected for new rides

docs.title: Managing Payment Methods
docs.text:
• Edit - Update card details or expiration dates
  • Delete - Remove payment methods you no longer use
  • Set Default - Choose which method to use by default

docs.title: Payment for Rides
docs.text:
Payment is processed automatically when the ride ends:

  1. The fare is charged to your default payment method
  2. You'll receive a receipt via email
  3. View payment details in Ride History

docs.title: Viewing Your Trips
docs.text:
1. Open the side menu
  2. Tap History or My Rides
  3. See all your past trips in chronological order

docs.title: Trip Details
docs.text:
Tap on any trip to view:

  • Route Map - Visual map of the trip
  • Addresses - Pickup and dropoff locations
  • Date & Time - When the trip occurred
  • Fare Breakdown:
  • Base fare
  • Distance charge
  • Time charge
  • Surge pricing (if applicable)
  • Taxes and fees
  • Total paid
  • Driver Info - Driver who completed the trip
  • Payment Method - How you paid

docs.title: Downloading Receipts
docs.text:
1. Open a trip from history
  2. Tap Receipt or Download Receipt
  3. Choose to:
  4. Download PDF
  5. Email to yourself
  6. Share with others

docs.title: Filtering History
docs.text:
• Search - Find trips by location or date
  • Date Range - Filter by specific time periods
  • Status - View completed, cancelled, or all trips

docs.title: Viewing Your Profile
docs.text:
1. Open the side menu
  2. Tap Profile or your name/photo at the top

docs.title: Editing Profile Information
docs.text:
1. Go to your profile
  2. Tap Edit Profile
  3. Update any of the following:
  4. Full name
  5. Phone number
  6. Profile photo
  7. Tap Save Changes

docs.title: Updating Profile Photo
docs.text:
1. In Edit Profile, tap the profile photo
  2. Choose:
  3. Take Photo - Use camera
  4. Choose from Library - Select existing photo
  5. Crop and adjust as needed
  6. Save changes

docs.title: Changing Email
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings from the side menu
  2. Tap Account Settings
  3. Select Change Email
  4. Enter new email address
  5. Verify via email confirmation

docs.title: Changing Password
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings
  2. Tap Account Settings
  3. Select Change Password
  4. Enter current password
  5. Enter new password
  6. Confirm new password
  7. Tap Update Password

docs.title: Share Trip
docs.text:
Share your live ride details with trusted contacts:

  1. During a ride, tap Share Trip
  2. Choose contact(s) to share with
  3. They'll receive a link to track your ride in real-time
  4. Sharing ends when the ride completes

docs.title: Emergency Contacts
docs.text:
Add emergency contacts for quick access:

  1. Go to Safety in the side menu
  2. Tap Emergency Contacts
  3. Tap Add Contact
  4. Select from your phone contacts or enter manually
  5. Save

docs.title: Emergency Button
docs.text:
If you feel unsafe during a ride:

  1. Tap the Emergency button (shield icon)
  2. Options:
  3. Call Emergency Services (911/local emergency number)
  4. Share Location with emergency contact
  5. Report Issue to Mobility support

docs.title: Safety Center
docs.text:
Access safety resources and tips:

  1. Go to Safety in the side menu
  2. Browse:
  3. Safety tips
  4. Community guidelines
  5. Driver verification info
  6. Insurance coverage details

docs.title: Rating Your Driver
docs.text:
After each ride:

  1. You'll see a rating screen
  2. Tap 1-5 stars (5 being excellent)
  3. Optionally select feedback categories:
  4. Great conversation
  5. Clean vehicle
  6. Safe driving
  7. Smooth ride
  8. Add written comments (optional)
  9. Tap Submit

docs.title: Your Passenger Rating
docs.text:
Drivers also rate passengers:

  1. View your rating in Profile
  2. Your rating is the average of all your trip ratings
  3. Maintain a good rating by:
  4. Being respectful
  5. Being ready at pickup time
  6. Not eating/drinking without asking
  7. Not leaving trash

docs.title: Reporting Issues
docs.text:
If you experienced a problem:

  1. Go to History
  2. Select the trip
  3. Tap Report Issue
  4. Choose issue type:
  5. Driver behavior
  6. Route problem
  7. Pricing issue
  8. Lost item
  9. Safety concern
  10. Provide details
  11. Submit report

docs.title: App Settings
docs.text:
1. Open the side menu
  2. Tap Settings

docs.title: General Settings
docs.text:
• Language - Choose your preferred language
  • Units - Miles or kilometers
  • Currency - Display currency preference

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Control what notifications you receive:

  • Ride Updates - Driver assigned, arrival, completion
  • Promotions - Special offers and discounts
  • Payment Notifications - Payment confirmations
  • General Announcements - App updates and news

Turn each on/off individually.

docs.title: Privacy Settings
docs.text:
• Location Services - Manage location permissions
  • Data Sharing - Control analytics and data collection
  • Profile Visibility - Control what drivers see

docs.title: Appearance
docs.text:
• Theme - Light, Dark, or Automatic (follows system)
  • Map Style - Choose map appearance

docs.title: Accessibility
docs.text:
• Text Size - Adjust font size
  • Screen Reader - Enable/disable
  • High Contrast - Improve visibility

docs.title: Viewing Available Offers
docs.text:
1. Go to Promotions in the side menu
  2. See all active promotions:
  3. Discount percentage or amount
  4. Expiration date
  5. Terms and conditions

docs.title: Applying Promo Codes
docs.text:
1. When booking a ride, tap Promo Code
  2. Enter the code
  3. Tap Apply
  4. Discount will be reflected in the fare estimate

docs.title: Earning Credits
docs.text:
You may earn ride credits through:

  • Referral program (invite friends)
  • Promotional campaigns
  • Loyalty rewards

View your credit balance in Profile → Wallet.

docs.title: Inviting Friends
docs.text:
1. Go to Referrals in the side menu
  2. Tap Invite Friends
  3. Share your unique referral code via:
  4. Text message
  5. Email
  6. Social media
  7. Copy link

docs.title: Earning Rewards
docs.text:
When friends sign up with your code:

  • They get a welcome bonus
  • You earn credits after their first ride
  • Track your referrals and rewards in the Referrals section

docs.title: Can't Sign In
docs.text:
• Verify email and password are correct
  • Try Forgot Password to reset
  • Check internet connection
  • Update app to latest version

docs.title: Location Not Working
docs.text:
• Enable Location Services in device settings
  • Grant location permission to Mobility app
  • Restart the app
  • Check GPS signal

docs.title: Map Not Loading
docs.text:
• Check internet connection
  • Verify Mapbox is not experiencing outages
  • Clear app cache (Settings → Clear Cache)
  • Reinstall the app if problem persists

docs.title: Payment Failed
docs.text:
• Verify payment method is valid and not expired
  • Check sufficient funds/credit limit
  • Try a different payment method
  • Contact your bank if card is declined

docs.title: Can't Find Driver
docs.text:
• Check the vehicle details (make, model, color, plate)
  • Call or message the driver
  • Check the pin location is accurate
  • Wait at the designated pickup spot

docs.title: Driver Cancelled
docs.text:
• You'll be automatically matched with another driver
  • No cancellation fee if driver cancels
  • Contact support if this happens repeatedly

docs.title: Wrong Fare Charged
docs.text:
• Review fare breakdown in trip details
  • Check for surge pricing
  • Report issue through the trip in History
  • Support will review and refund if necessary

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• In-App Support - Side menu → Support
  • Email - support@mobility.com
  • Phone - Available in Support section
  • Help Center - Browse FAQs and guides

docs.title: For Riders
docs.text:
1. Set Exact Pickup Location - Be specific to avoid confusion
  2. Be Ready - Be at pickup location when driver arrives
  3. Communicate - Message driver if you're running late
  4. Verify Vehicle - Check license plate before entering
  5. Buckle Up - Always wear your seatbelt
  6. Be Respectful - Treat drivers with courtesy
  7. Rate Honestly - Help improve the community
  8. Save Favorite Locations - Makes booking faster
  9. Keep App Updated - Get latest features and fixes
  10. Share Trips - Share important rides with family

docs.title: Saving Money
docs.text:
• Use promo codes when available
  • Book during off-peak hours to avoid surge pricing
  • Choose Economy for budget-friendly rides
  • Share rides with friends (when feature is available)
  • Refer friends to earn credits

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Features - Explore all platform features
  • Configuration - Customize your experience
  • Safety - Learn more about safety features
  • Support - Get help when needed

docs.title: TinyShop Setup Guide
docs.text: Get your TinyShop store up and running quickly with this step-by-step guide.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before setting up TinyShop, ensure you have:

  • A domain name
  • Web hosting with PHP support
  • MySQL or PostgreSQL database
  • SSL certificate (recommended)

docs.title: Step 1: Download TinyShop
docs.text: Download the latest version from your account dashboard.

docs.title: Step 2: Upload Files
docs.text:
Upload all files to your web server:

# Using FTP/SFTP
# Upload the tinyshop folder to your web root

docs.title: Step 3: Database Setup
docs.text:
Create a new database and import the schema:

CREATE DATABASE tinyshop;
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON tinyshop.* TO 'tinyshop_user'@'localhost';

docs.title: Step 4: Configuration
docs.text:
Edit the configuration file:

// config.php
define('DB_HOST', 'localhost');
define('DB_NAME', 'tinyshop');
define('DB_USER', 'tinyshop_user');
define('DB_PASS', 'your_password');

docs.title: Step 5: Run Setup Wizard
docs.text:
Navigate to https://yourstore.com/setup and complete the setup wizard:

  1. Verify system requirements
  2. Configure database connection
  3. Set up admin account
  4. Configure basic store settings

docs.title: Store Information
docs.text:
Set up your basic store information:

  • Store name
  • Logo and branding
  • Contact information
  • Business address

docs.title: Payment Methods
docs.text:
Configure payment gateways:

  • PayPal
  • Stripe
  • Bank transfer
  • Cash on delivery

docs.title: Shipping Options
docs.text:
Set up shipping methods:

  • Flat rate
  • Free shipping
  • Location-based rates

docs.title: Important Security Steps
docs.text:
1. Delete the /setup folder after installation
  2. Change default admin credentials
  3. Enable SSL/HTTPS
  4. Set proper file permissions

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
Verify your installation:

  • Admin panel is accessible
  • Store front page loads
  • Test checkout process

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• User Guide - Learn to manage your store
  • Configuration - Advanced settings

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Common setup issues:

  • Database connection error - Verify credentials
  • Permission denied - Check file permissions
  • White screen - Enable error logging

Need help? Visit our Support page.

docs.title: WiWebb API Reference
docs.text: Complete API documentation for integrating with WiWebb.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The WiWebb API is a RESTful API that allows you to programmatically interact with your WiWebb instance.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API requests require authentication using API keys.

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  https://api.wiwebb.example.com/v1/endpoint

docs.title: List Users
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/users

Returns a list of all users.

docs.title: Get User
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/users/{id}

Retrieve a specific user by ID.

docs.title: Create Content
docs.text:
POST /api/v1/content

Create new content.

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text: API requests are limited to 1000 requests per hour.

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text: The API uses standard HTTP status codes for error responses.

docs.title: SDKs
docs.text:
Official SDKs coming soon for:

  • Python
  • JavaScript
  • PHP
  • Java
